perturbation.original_text: 4.2.2 In consideration of the Due Diligence Services, ISA shall pay to Rubicon the Due Diligence Fees within 30 days of receipt  from Rubicon of an invoice and any previously requested supporting documentation, including time charges.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2.2 In consideration of the Due Diligence Services, ISA shall pay to Rubicon the Due Diligence Fees within 60 days of receipt  from Rubicon of an invoice and any previously requested supporting documentation, including time charges.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by changing the payment terms. Section 4.2.2 now states that payment should be made within 60 days for Due Diligence Fees, while Section 4.4 stipulates 30 days for all payments, causing uncertainty and potential for dispute.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Payment terms. Each party shall account to the other on a monthly basis in respect of all sales and revenue received, and payments  shall be made within 30 days of receipt of a properly valid invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4 Payment terms. Each party shall account to the other on a monthly basis in respect of all sales and revenue received, and payments  shall be made within 45 days of receipt of a properly valid invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by changing the payment terms. Section 4.4 now states that payment should be made within 45 days, while Section 4.2.2 stipulates 60 days for the Due Diligence Fees, causing uncertainty and potential for dispute.

perturbation.original_text: 6.2.1 For Cause. Either Party may serve Notice to the other Party to terminate this Agreement immediately in the event any material  breach of a material provision of this Agreement by such other Party remains uncured 30 days in the case of a breach of a payment obligation, or  45 days for all other material breaches, after notice of such breach was received by such other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.2.1 For Cause. Either Party may serve Notice to the other Party to terminate this Agreement immediately in the event any material  breach of a material provision of this Agreement by such other Party remains uncured 60 days in the case of a breach of a payment obligation, or  45 days for all other material breaches, after notice of such breach was received by such other Party.
perturbation.explanation: Section 6.2.1 originally stated the cure period for breach of payment obligation is 30 days, now it's modified to 60. This is in direct conflict with Section 4.2.2 where payment obligation is now 45 days and creates a contradiction.
